title: Slow But Steady
summary:
Key ideas
- Malaria reduction in Africa, largely due to the use of bednets
- The effectiveness of bednets at both individual and population levels
- Bednets have prevented roughly 450 million cases of malaria globally
- Funding bednet distribution is one of the most cost-effective ways to prevent disease and death

Key learnings
- Bednets are a powerful tool in the fight against malaria
- Malaria has a significant economic burden on healthcare systems and individuals
- Bednet distribution is a cost-effective way to prevent disease and death
- One can donate to the Against Malaria Foundation to contribute to bednet distribution

Key questions
- How can we ensure the continued funding and distribution of bednets?
- What other interventions are effective for preventing malaria?
- How can we address the economic burden of malaria on healthcare systems and individuals?
